resources.string:
Welcome to NakhelAI!
This AI tool identifies palm types (Khalas, Razzez, Shishi).

How to use:
1) Take Photo or Upload File
2) Provide an image
3) Get instant results!
Ensemble of ConvNeXt Small models (TFLite). Uses Test Time Augmentation (flip) to classify palm types with robustness.

Khalas is a variety of date palm fruit, famous in the regions of Al-Qassim, Al-Kharj, and Al-Ahsa in Saudi Arabia. It is distinguished by its ability to retain its excellent flavor even after long periods of storage. It has an apricot-yellow color, a sweet taste, and is typically served with Arabic coffee during social occasions.\n\nIt is considered one of the finest varieties of dates, accounting for approximately 15% to 20% of the palm trees in Al-Ahsa. As a premium commercial variety, it is highly sought after in markets due to its superior quality and long-lasting flavor profile.

Physical Characteristics:
Color: Primarily brown with a distinct golden-yellow base.
Size & Texture: Known for its large size and a thick, slightly dry texture.
Moisture Content: Contains a moisture level of approximately 17.46%.

Taste & Market Significance:
Flavor Profile: It is classified as an intensely sweet variety of date.
Economic Importance:
Along with the "Khalas" and "Razzez" varieties, it accounts for 75% of the total production in Al-Ahsa.
The Shishi date alone constitutes 50% of Saudi Arabia's overall date production.

Historical Status & Production:
Origin: Famous in the Al-Ahsa Governorate of the Eastern Province; it was historically the most prominent date variety in the region.
Current Rarity: It is now considered a rare variety because most farmers have prioritized the cultivation of "Khalas" dates.
Economic Value: Along with Khalas and Shishi, it accounts for 75% of Al-Ahsa's total production. The average price per "Mann" (a traditional unit of weight) is approximately 700 SAR.

Characteristics & Uses:
Size & Appearance: A medium-sized date with a visible outer skin.

This application utilizes advanced deep learning algorithms specifically designed for agricultural image processing. The core engine is built upon an ensemble of ConvNeXt Small neural networks, optimized for mobile deployment via TensorFlow Lite. This ensures high accuracy and low latency during real-time palm tree classification.
